creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: horizontal landscape with bamboo, grasses, rocks and water, ending in a scene with snow-covered bamboo; two short text blocks at end
dimension:
260 1/16 x 12 7/8 in. (660.56 x 32.7 cm) (image)
330 5/16 x 13 3/8 in. (839 x 33.97 cm) (overall, without roller)
text: One technique commonly used in the flower-and-bird painting tradition is daoyun, a reverse-saturation method in which the flowers or plants are left as negative space—areas of white against an ink-wash ground. The method emerged from painters’ attempts to capture the brilliant whiteness of blossoms and plants in moonlight—or in winter, as seen in this scroll.
title: Bamboo Landscape
